botanical_details.genus: Pelargonium can be perennials, sub-shrubs or shrubs, sometimes succulent and mostly evergreen, with palmately lobed or pinnately divided leaves and clusters of slightly irregular, 5-petalled flowers
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Regal pelargoniums are evergreen perennials or subshrubs, bushy in habit, with rounded, often lobed leaves and usually single flowers to 4cm across, borne in clusters in late spring and into summer, in shades of pink, red, orange and purple or white

how_to_grow.cultivation: A high potash feed will encourage continuous flowering through late spring and summer. Can be moved outside after danger of frosts has passed. See pelargonium cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cuttings in spring and summer
how_to_grow.pruning: Cut back by half in early spring to encourage flowering; deadhead regularly
how_to_grow.pests: Generally trouble-free, but may suffer from aphids in spring
how_to_grow.diseases: Generally trouble-free, but may suffer from grey moulds, Pelargonium rust and Pelargonium viruses
